view

Class AlbumDetailController

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.AlbumDetailController

  • public class AlbumDetailController
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    anand This is the controller responsible for showing the actual Photos in the album.

      • AlbumDetailController

        public AlbumDetailController()

    • Method Detail

      • initData

        public void initData(UsersApp ap,
                     User u,
                     Album selected)
        Used for passing the specific albums and album data for the controller to use
        Parameters:
        ap - The UsersApp to write the saved data
        u - The user data to pass back to AlbumListView
        selected - The chosen album to be viewed.

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage mainStage)
           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                  java.io.IOException
        Upon running, loads all the images from stock folder, then displays thumbnails using a cell factory and a listener. When the window is closed, it saves all the data to the user app.
        Parameters:
        mainStage -
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • gotoTags

        public void gotoTags(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Eventhandler for editing the tags. When the 'edit tags' button is pressed, the function calls a dialogue view that lets the user add, edit, and delete tags. Once the dialogue is closed, the photo is updated.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • backtoAlbum

        public void backtoAlbum(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Eventhandler responsible for going back to the AlbumListView. Passes it's stored UserApp and user data back to the view to display all the user's albums.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • editCaption

        public void editCaption()
        Event handler for editing the caption. When pressing 'Edit Caption' button, it opens up a TextInput Dialog which asks the user to input a caption. Once it gets a result, it immidiately recaptions and updates the Photo.

      • next_prev_Photo

        public void next_prev_Photo(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Eventhandler for the slideshow buttons.
        Parameters:
        e - If '>>' selects the Photo the "right" (The Image ListView is vertical, so below) and '<<' selects the photo to the "left".

      • updatePhoto

        public void updatePhoto(Photo p)
        Essentially refreshes the photo, making sure the controller displays the right caption and the right tags.
        Parameters:
        p - The Photo you want to refresh

      • uploadPhoto

        public void uploadPhoto()
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Eventhandler for adding a photo to the Album. The function opens a FileChooser and allows the user to add a photo from their library.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • updateAlbum

        public void updateAlbum()
        A helper method that refreshes the whole album

      • photo_manuver

        public void photo_manuver(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Eventhandler for the 'move' and copy buttons. First, a choicebox dialogue opens up allowing the user to choose which album they want to move the selected photo to. If they confirm an album, the photo is either copied or moved depending on the album.
        Parameters:
        e - ActionEvent can either be 'move' or 'copy' buttons

      • removePhoto

        public void removePhoto()
        Eventhandling for removing the photo from the album.

      • copyTo

        public boolean copyTo(Photo p,
                      Album a,
                      Album b)
        Takes a photo, and copies it from one album to another.
        Parameters:
        p - The photo you want to copy
        a - The Source Album you're copying the photo from
        b - The Destination Album you're copying the photo to

      • moveTo

        public boolean moveTo(Photo p,
                      Album a,
                      Album b)
        Takes a photo, and moves it from one album to another.
        Parameters:
        p - The photo you want to move
        a - The Source Album you're moving, and removing the photo from
        b - The Destination Album you're moving the photo to
